user_persona: A local researcher exploring neighborhood trends.
user_goal: To navigate the map smoothly using zoom and pan controls.

narrative_steps.title: Initial Map Load
narrative_steps.description: Sarah opens the app and sees a full-screen map centered on her city. She notices the zoom controls in the top-left corner.
narrative_steps.action: Observe the map loading with default view and visible zoom controls.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The map loads fully with zoom buttons visible, featuring forest green icons on an ivory background.

narrative_steps.title: Zooming In
narrative_steps.description: Curious about a specific district, Sarah clicks the '+' button to get a closer look at neighborhood boundaries.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The map zooms in smoothly without page reload, showing more detailed boundaries.

narrative_steps.title: Panning Across the Map
narrative_steps.description: Sarah wants to see adjacent areas, so she clicks and drags the map to move around.
narrative_steps.action: Click and drag the map canvas.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The map pans smoothly in the direction of the drag, revealing surrounding regions.

requirement_tested: Allow users to select and compare multiple neighborhoods
user_persona: A community planner evaluating development needs.
user_goal: To select two neighborhoods for comparative analysis.

narrative_steps.title: First Neighborhood Selection
narrative_steps.description: Maria identifies a neighborhood of interest on the map and clicks it to add to her comparison set.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The neighborhood becomes visually highlighted and appears in the comparison panel below.

narrative_steps.title: Adding Another Area
narrative_steps.description: Maria selects a second nearby neighborhood by clicking it, intending to compare both areas.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Both neighborhoods are now highlighted, and their basic stats show side-by-side in the comparison panel.

user_persona: An urban sociologist studying population dynamics.
user_goal: To analyze age distribution differences between selected neighborhoods.

narrative_steps.title: Opening Demographics Section
narrative_steps.description: After selecting two neighborhoods, Dr. Lee looks at the demographic charts to understand population makeup.
narrative_steps.action: Navigate to the demographic visualization section.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Charts like Age Distribution Pie Chart appear in collapsible cards with forest green headers.

narrative_steps.title: Interacting With Chart Data
narrative_steps.description: Dr. Lee hovers over segments of the pie chart to see exact percentages for each age group.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Tooltips display precise percentage values for hovered data points.

user_persona: A policy analyst reviewing regional economic health.
user_goal: To compare employment rates across selected neighborhoods.

narrative_steps.title: Viewing Economic Charts
narrative_steps.description: James navigates to the economic data section to examine job market conditions.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Employment Rate Line Chart and other relevant graphs load within expandable panels.

narrative_steps.title: Filtering Time Range
narrative_steps.description: Wanting recent data, James clicks on the year axis label to focus on the last five years.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Chart updates to show only data from the selected time range.

user_persona: A safety advocate researching local crime patterns.
user_goal: To identify which types of crimes are most prevalent in selected areas.

narrative_steps.title: Examining Crime Charts
narrative_steps.description: Patricia goes to the crime data section to understand safety concerns in two neighborhoods.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Incident Type Bar Charts and Heatmaps load in collapsible containers themed with forest green.

narrative_steps.title: Focusing on Specific Crimes
narrative_steps.description: She toggles off less relevant categories by clicking on legend items to better see violent crimes.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Selected crime categories disappear from the chart, simplifying the visualization.

requirement_tested: Provide data dashboard with interactive charts
user_persona: A data journalist compiling neighborhood insights.
user_goal: To organize all charts into a single dashboard view for comprehensive analysis.

narrative_steps.title: Dashboard Initialization
narrative_steps.description: Lena opens the dashboard tab to see all her charts together in one place.
narrative_steps.action: Navigate to the main dashboard view.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A responsive grid layout displays all active charts in individual tiles with forest green borders.

narrative_steps.title: Rearanging Widgets
narrative_steps.description: Wanting easier comparison, Lena drags the demographic chart next to the economic one.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Widgets snap into new positions, maintaining visual organization.

user_persona: A frequent user who prefers personalized workspace setups.
user_goal: To save a preferred layout for future visits.

narrative_steps.title: Resizing Widgets
narrative_steps.description: Tom adjusts the size of his favorite chart to make it more prominent.
narrative_steps.action: Resize a chart widget by dragging its edges.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Widget resizes smoothly, fitting the new dimensions within the grid.

narrative_steps.title: Saving Layout Preferences
narrative_steps.description: Satisfied with the arrangement, Tom saves the layout for later use.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Save Layout' option in the customization toolbar.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Current layout configuration is stored and applied automatically on next visit.

user_persona: A busy parent looking up school districts quickly.
user_goal: To find a specific neighborhood using the search bar.

narrowative_steps.title: Using Auto-complete Search
narrowative_steps.description: Lisa starts typing her target neighborhood name into the search bar and watches suggestions appear.
narrowative_steps.action: Type into the search input field.
narrowative_steps.expected_outcome: A dropdown list of matching neighborhoods appears instantly below the search bar.

narrowative_steps.title: Selecting a Match
narrowative_steps.description: Seeing the correct result, Lisa clicks it to center the map on that area.
narrowative_steps.expected_outcome: Map centers on the selected neighborhood and highlights its boundaries.

requirement_tested: Support data filtering by area boundaries
user_persona: A city official analyzing policy impact zones.
user_goal: To isolate data for a custom-defined region.

narrative_steps.title: Activating Drawing Tool
narrative_steps.description: David activates the drawing tool to outline a custom area affected by recent zoning changes.
narrative_steps.action: Click the drawing tool activation button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Drawing cursor is enabled, ready to create a polygon on the map.

narrative_steps.title: Defining Custom Boundary
narrative_steps.description: He clicks several points on the map to trace the boundary and double-clicks to finalize it.
narrative_steps.action: Click to place vertices, then double-click to complete the polygon.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Polygon is created, and data updates automatically to reflect only the defined area.

user_persona: A real estate agent helping clients choose locations.
user_goal: To easily compare key metrics of two neighborhoods.

narrative_steps.title: Entering Comparison View
narrative_steps.description: Rey selects two neighborhoods and switches to side-by-side view for clearer comparison.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Screen splits into two panes, each showing metrics and charts for one neighborhood.

narrative_steps.title: Synchronized Scrolling
narrative_steps.description: While reading through details, Rey scrolls down one pane and notices the other scrolls too.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: All panes scroll simultaneously, keeping related sections aligned.

user_goal: To style charts professionally before including them in presentations.

narrative_steps.title: Opening Chart Settings
narrative_steps.description: Alex clicks the settings icon on a chart to modify its appearance for client review.
narrative_steps.action: Click the gear/settings icon on a chart header.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A modal window opens with form fields for adjusting chart properties.

narrative_steps.title: Applying Style Changes
narrative_steps.description: After choosing a minimalist theme and updating labels, Alex submits the changes.
narrative_steps.action: Fill out customization form and submit.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Chart instantly reflects the new styling choices.

user_persona: A researcher needing offline data access.
user_goal: To download current chart data for further analysis.

narrative_steps.title: Choosing Export Format
narrative_steps.description: Jamie wants to share findings, so she clicks the export button and chooses CSV format.
narrative_steps.action: Click the export button and select CSV from dropdown.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Dropdown menu shows file format options including CSV, PDF, and PNG.

narrative_steps.title: Downloading File
narrative_steps.description: With CSV selected, Jamie confirms the download to save the data locally.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: File downloads automatically with accurate representation of current chart data.

requirement_tested: Include zoom and pan controls for the map
user_persona: A tourist planning walking routes through neighborhoods.
user_goal: To explore detailed street-level maps using intuitive controls.

narrative_steps.title: Using Mouse Wheel Zoom
narrative_steps.description: Exploring a potential route, Sam uses his mouse wheel to zoom in and out smoothly.
narrative_steps.action: Scroll mouse wheel over the map.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Map zooms continuously and smoothly in the direction of scrolling.

narrative_steps.title: Resetting View
narrative_steps.description: Lost after zooming in, Sam hits the home button to return to the starting view.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Map resets to original default view and zoom level.

requirement_tested: Show data legends and key metrics
user_persona: A student learning about urban geography.
user_goal: To understand what the colors and numbers on the map represent.

narrative_steps.title: Reading Legend Information
narrative_steps.description: Trying to interpret the heat map, Mia glances at the floating legend panel on the right.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Legend lists color codes and classifications clearly, explaining what each hue signifies.

narrative_steps.title: Identifying Key Metrics
narrative_steps.description: Mia notices small badges at the top showing average income and population density.
narrative_steps.action: Observe key metric badges near map top.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Key metrics are displayed in circular or rectangular badges with readable values.

requirement_tested: Implement ivory background with forest green components
user_persona: A UX designer auditing interface consistency.
user_goal: To verify that all UI elements follow the specified color scheme.

narrative_steps.title: Checking Background Color
narrative_steps.description: Verifying design standards, Casey inspects whether the main background is indeed ivory.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Entire application background renders as ivory (#FFFFF0).

narrative_steps.title: Validating Accent Colors
narrative_steps.description: Casey checks that interactive elements like buttons and chart axes use forest green.
narrative_steps.action: Inspect actionable UI components like buttons and headers.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: All interactive and accent elements consistently use forest green (#228B22).
